articles.author: Sam Fossum, Peter Valdes-Dapena
articles.title: Biden administration announces a $1.7 billion plan to juice electric vehicles in America - CNN
articles.description: The White House on Thursday said it would hand out $1.7 billion to help convert shuttered or at-risk auto manufacturing and assembly facilities to make electric and hybrid vehicles.
articles.content:
The White House on Thursday said it would hand out $1.7 billion to help convert closed-down or at-risk auto manufacturing and assembly facilities to make electric and hybrid vehicles.

articles.author: Michael Loria
articles.title: Are bullets on your grocery list? Ammo vending machines debut in grocery stores - USA TODAY
articles.description: American Rounds, an ammo vending machine company, has installed machines in stores in three states. Buyers have to show ID.
articles.content: Shoppers at select grocery stores around the South can pick up something new: ammunition dispensed from a high-tech vending machine that contains a plentiful assortment of 12-gauge shotgun shells and… [+4323 chars]

articles.title: Kevin Costner’s next ‘Horizon’ film pulled from August theatrical release schedule - CNN
articles.description: The next film in Kevin Costner’s ambitious western movie franchise has been postponed. The sequel to the currently-in-theaters “Horizon: An American Saga - Chapter 1” was scheduled to be released in theaters on August 16.

articles.title: Person in Colorado infected with bubonic plague. Here's what to know. - USA TODAY
articles.description: Wild rodents in the American West commonly carry bubonic plague. State officials say to avoid contact with animals and to take care of pets.
articles.content:
A person in Pueblo County, Colorado, about 100 miles south of Denver, has been infected with bubonic plague, local health officials said Monday.
